result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David W Patterson Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David W Patterson Sr in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by phone for David W Patterson Sr.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing. Defense counsel was not properly added to the case as counsel. Court finds Order Appointing counsel was declined, to be re-issued. Defense requests a adjourned plea/sentencing hearing. Court adjourns matter for plea and sentencing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Order Submitted in PDF Format Declined

records.addlTxt:
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
*
Status conference held.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant David W Patterson in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Nicholas Conrardy to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 9/1/2022 and on the 1st of each month. Defendant to pay a maximum amount of $1000.00.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Case passed.
Indigency hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David W Patterson in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Franke. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of  any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.C.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David W Patterson in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Franke, Branch 25.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
